1.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
harvest (as the crop), whether the product (grain or fruit) or the (dry) season
only in plural gleanings; by extension gleaning-time
a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle
a bunch of grapes or other fruit
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)

2.brief: properly, to wander away, i.e. lose oneself; by implication to perish (causative, destroy)
properly, a part of; hence (prepositionally), from or out of in many senses
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
ruddy i.e. a human being (an individual or the species, mankind, etc.)
a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
blood (as that which when shed causes death) of man or an animal; by analogy, the juice of the grape; figuratively (especially in the plural) bloodshed (i.e. drops of blood)
a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
a brother (used in the widest sense of literal relationship and metaphorical affinity or resemblance (like father))
to lie alongside (i.e. in wait); by implication, to catch an animal (figuratively, men); to victual (for a journey)
physical (as shutting in) a net (either literally or figuratively); usually a doomed object; abstractly extermination

3.brief: above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
bad or (as noun) evil (natural or moral)
the hollow hand or palm (so of the paw of an animal, of the sole, and even of the bowl of a dish or sling, the handle of a bolt, the leaves of a palm-tree); figuratively, power
to be (causative) make well, literally (sound, beautiful) or figuratively (happy, successful, right)
a head person (of any rank or class)
to inquire; by implication, to request; by extension, to demand
to judge, i.e. pronounce sentence (for or against); by implication, to vindicate or punish; by extenssion, to govern; passively, to litigate (literally or figuratively)
a requital, i.e. (secure) retribution, (venal) a fee
great (in any sense); hence, older; also insolent
perhaps properly, to arrange; but used figuratively (of words), to speak; rarely (in a destructive sense) to subdue
by implication, of falling); desire; also ruin
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)

he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are

4.brief: good (as an adjective) in the widest sense; used likewise as a noun, both in the masculine and the feminine, the singular and the plural (good, a good or good thing, a good man or woman; the good, goods or good things, good men or women), also as an adverb (well)
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
properly, to lean forward, i.e. to peer into the distance; by implication, to observe, await
to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)
at this time, whether adverb, conjunction or expletive
to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)

5.brief: not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing
properly, to build up or support; to foster as a parent or nurse; figuratively to render (or be) firm or faithful, to trust or believe, to be permanent or quiet; morally to be true or certain;
not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing
figuratively, to trust, be confident or sure
familiar; a friend, also gentle; hence, a bullock (as being tame; applied, although masculine, to a cow); and so, a chieftain (as notable, like neat cattle)
to lie down (for rest, sexual connection, decease or any other purpose)
properly, to hedge about (as with thorns), i.e. guard; generally, to protect, attend to, etc.
an opening (literally), i.e. door (gate) or entrance way
the mouth (as the means of blowing), whether literal or figurative (particularly speech); specifically edge, portion or side; adverbially (with preposition) according to

6.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
to wilt; generally, to fall away, fail, faint; figuratively, to be foolish or (morally) wicked; causatively, to despise, disgrace
father, in a literal and immediate, or figurative and remote application
a daughter (used in the same wide sense as other terms of relationship, literally and figuratively)
to rise (in various applications, literal, figurative, intensive and causative)
a mother (as the bond of the family); in a wide sense (both literally and figuratively (like father))
a bride (as if perfect); hence, a son's wife
a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
a house (in the greatest variation of applications, especially family, etc.)

properly, to lean forward, i.e. to peer into the distance; by implication, to observe, await
to wait; by implication, to be patient, hope

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative

probably to brighten up, i.e. (figuratively) be (causatively, make) blithe or gleesome

to fall, in a great variety of applications (intransitive or causative, literal or figurative)

illumination or (concrete) luminary (in every sense, including lightning, happiness, etc.)

to lift, in a great variety of applications, literal and figurative, absolute and relative
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
properly, to miss; hence (figuratively and generally) to sin; by inference, to forfeit, lack, expiate, repent, (causatively) lead astray, condemn
as far (or long, or much) as, whether of space (even unto) or time (during, while, until) or degree (equally with)
who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
properly, to toss, i.e. grapple; mostly figuratively, to wrangle, i.e. hold a controversy; (by implication) to defend
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
